text: Gregory Wright Carman (January 31, 1937 â€“ April 5, 2020) was an American judge and politician. He was a United States Judge of the United States Court of International Trade from 1983 to 2014. He was nominated by President Ronald Reagan. He was a Republican member of the United States House of Representatives from New York from 1981 to 1983. Carman was born in Farmingdale, New York. He died on April 5, 2020 in Melville, New York, aged 83. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American judges Category:United States representatives from New York (state) Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Gregory W. Carman
